biotools.summary: PLAST is a heuristical method to search for highest scoring local alignments between a DNA sequence query and a graphical pangenome. It takes as input a plain DNA sequence and a pangenome which may either be a set of (multiple) FASTA or FASTQ files or a sequence graph constructed by the tool Bifrost. It then outputs statistically meaningful (gapped) alignments in the style of the NCBI BLAST standard output format. Alignments are calculated based on a "seed-and-extend approach" while traversing the sequence graph. Biologically meaningful alignments are filtered by using an alignment statistic explicitly developed for sequence-to-graph alignments involving graphical pangenomes.
